REALOCATION

Premium HTML Real Estate Template

Basics

Before starting to work with Realocation, there are some basic concepts/technologies you need to be familiar with.

If you are not familiar with HTML, please start learning from basics before you proceed with this theme - HTML Basics

If you are not familiar with CSS, please start learning from basics before you proceed with this theme - CSS Basics

If you are not familiar with JavaScript, please start learning from basics before you proceed with this theme - JavaScript Basics

However this theme uses more advanced technologies or framework also, like Sass, Compass and jQuery library. However those are not mandatory to use. But mastering this technologies, will result in easier managment and faster and more flexible site building.

  • jQuery
  • Sass
  • Compass

Overview

Realocation HTML package contains 2 version of codes. HTML codes ( in folder "HTML" ), and for convenience also PHP ( in folder "PHP" ) codes divided into smaller files.

This documentation will discuss mainly PHP files which present the same codes and design as HTML, however are divided to smaller files and thus are easier to learn from.

If you want to run PHP version you can use one of these free Apache server solutions.

  • Windows, Mac, Linux - XAMPP
  • Mac - MAMP

Realocation offers 44 designed pages!

Folder structure

  • assets
    • css - contains css files which were generated from scss files
    • scss - contains scss files.

      Realocation utilizes power of css syntax engine - Sass

      • Read more about Sass
      • Read more about Compass
    • img - contains site images
    • js - contains site javascripts
    • fonts - contains fonts used on the site
    • libraries - contains third party libraries used in the theme
    helpers
    • blocks - various content related blocks
    • footers - footer variants
    • headers - Headers variants
    • Widgets - various pieces of codes/helpers used across the template

Bootstrap

Realocation template uses Bootstrap library heavily. Please consider the bootstrap 3 documentation as extended documentation to Realocation template, as most of the answers can be found there.

Please pay increased attention to following sections of Bootstrap documentation:
  • Grid
  • Buttons
  • Forms
  • Input Groups
  • Navigation
  • Navbar
  • Carousel

Javascript

The main javascript file is stored in assets/js/realocation.js This file utilizes all codes used in Realocation template. Additional Library javascripts are included:

  • jquery.js
  • gmap3.clusterer.js - Library allows to create clusters on map. See the official documentation
  • gmap3.infobox.js - Library allows to create customized infoboxes. See the official documentation
  • jquery.chained.js - Allows creating of chained select boxes
  • map.js - Map handling and initializations

Main javascript file is very well commented, thus will not be discussed in the documentation. Please go trough the codes and read the comments if you want to know more.

Map

In order to push you own properties into the map you need to edit relocation.js ( assets/js/relocation.js). Currently the code is generated randomly in a cycle on line 87. ( You can delete the cycle and push in your own values ) Map item consist from 4 variables

  • locations - array - gps coordinates
  • contents - array - content of infobox (html which will show after clickin of the pin )
  • types - array - type of property
  • images - array - icon to use in the pin

How to set location

        locations.push(new Array(latitude, longitude));

How to set type

        types.push('apartment');

How to set icon

        images.push('<img src="path/to/icon">');

How to set content

        contents.push(content);

Where content can be represented as a string like:

<div class="infobox">
    <div class="infobox-header">
        <h3 class="infobox-title"><a href="#">Property Title</a></h3>
        <h4 class="infobox-subtitle"><a href="#">Subtitle</a></h4></div>
        <div class="infobox-picture"><a href="#"><img src="path/to/image" alt="#"></a>
        <div class="infobox-price">100 000</div>
    </div>
</div>

After pushing appropriate values for each property you want to get displayed on map into variables, appropriate pin will display on map

Functional Logic ( PHP Version Only )

There is very little functional logic behind Realocation HTML template. All of the logic concerns mainly generating of random data, properties and agents. All the codes are located in content.php file and are very well commented. Go trough the codes if you want to learn how is the content generated. 


/**
 * Pickup random image for property
 * @param string $size
 * @return mixed
 */
function get_image($size = 'large') {
  static $images;
  if(empty($images)){
    for($i = 1; $i<=12; $i++) {
      $images[] = 'assets/img/tmp/properties/' . $size . '/' . $i . '.jpg';
    }
  }

  $key = array_rand($images);

  $value = $images[$key];
  unset($images[$key]);

  return $value;
}


/**
 * Pickup random image for agent
 * @param string $size
 * @return mixed
 */
function get_agent_image($size = 'medium') {
  static $agent_images;
  if(empty($agent_images)){
    for($i = 1; $i<=4; $i++) {
      $agent_images[] = 'assets/img/tmp/agents/' . $size . '/' . $i . '.jpg';
    }
  }

  $key = array_rand($agent_images);

  $value = $agent_images[$key];
  unset($agent_images[$key]);

  return $value;
}

/**
 * Get number representing area
 * @return int
 */
function get_area() {
  return rand(120, 350);
}

/**
 * Get random number - used for bathrooms, bedrooms...
 * @return int
 */
function get_number() {
  return rand(1,3);
}

/**
 * Return random location - don't repeat if not necessary
 * @return mixed
 */
function get_location() {
  static $locations;

  if(empty($locations)) {
    $locations = array(
      'Brooklyn',
      'Manhattan',
      'Silicon Valley, SA',
      'Palo Alto, SA',
      'Kingman Park',
      'Civic Betterment',
    );
  }

  $key = array_rand($locations);

  $value = $locations[$key];
  unset($locations[$key]);

  return $value;
}

/**
 * Return random title - don't repeat if not necessary
 * @return mixed
 */
function get_title() {

  static $titles;

  if(empty($titles)) {
    $titles = array(
      'Everett Ave',
      'Fife Ave',
      'Emerson Street',
      'Culver Blvd',
      'McLaugh Ave',
      'Jefferson Blvd',
      'West Side',
      'South St',
      'Evergreen Tr',
      'Jeopardy Ln',
      'Hansbury Ave',
      'St Johns Pl',
      'Bedford Ave',
    );
  }

  $key = array_rand($titles);

  $value = $titles[$key];
  unset($titles[$key]);

  return $value;
}

/**
 * Return random price
 * @param string $type
 * @return mixed
 */
function get_price($type = 'sale') {

  if($type == 'sale') {
    $values =  array(
      '$ 299 000',
      '$ 350 000',
      '$ 145 000',
      '$ 545 000',
      '$ 430 000',
    );

    $key = array_rand($values);

    return $values[$key];
  }

  $values =  array(
    '$ 1900 / month',
    '$ 1200 / month',
    '$ 2400 / month',
    '$ 850 / month',
    '$ 1500 / month',
  );

  $key = array_rand($values);
  return $values[$key];
}

Libraries used

  • Font Awesome - icon-graphic font used for site icons
  • bxSlider - responsive carousel plugin
  • Isotope - dynamic sorting plugin
  • FlexSlider - responsive slideshow solution
